trans-unit.source: Provides the extensible Application Markup Language (XAML) serialization services to workflows at design time.

<xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Serialization.WorkflowMarkupSerializer> provides methods that serialize workflow and <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Activity> classes into XAML format and deserialize XAML content into workflow and activity class objects.
These services are primarily used by workflow designers to persist the classes on the workflow design surface.

<xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Serialization.WorkflowMarkupSerializer> is the base class for all markup serializers included in the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Serialization> namespace.
For more information, see [Serialization](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/4d1111c0-9447-4231-a997-96a2b74b3453).
<xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Serialization.WorkflowMarkupSerializer> does not support serialization of nested types.
The functionality of <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Serialization.WorkflowMarkupSerializer> is dependent on functionality of other types outside of Windows Workflow Foundation.
Based on the limitations of those other types, not all data types can be serialized through the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Serialization.WorkflowMarkupSerializer>.
The following is a list is an example of some unsupported types.
This is not an exhaustive and complete list of unsupported types.
Arrays (supported only if property is not decorated with `DesignerSerializationVisibility.Content` attribute value)
Types without parameterless constructors
Multidimensional Arrays
Generic types (Generic `List` and `Dictionary` types supported only if property is decorated with `DesignerSerializationVisibility.Content` attribute value)
Enumeration Arrays
Enumerations decorated with the FlagsAttribute
In addition to this list, any property decorated with both the `ContentPropertyAttibute` and the `DesignerSerializationVisibilityAttribute` cannot be serialized by `WorkflowMarkupSerializer`.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Serialization.WorkflowMarkupSerializer"></xref> class.
Adds a child object to the specified object.
Other than exception behavior, <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Serialization.WorkflowMarkupSerializer.AddChild%2A> provides no default behavior.
You must override <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Serialization.WorkflowMarkupSerializer> to provide logic for this method in an inheriting serializer.
The <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Serialization.WorkflowMarkupSerializationManager"></xref> to use in this operation.
The <xref href="System.Object"></xref> to which to add the child object.
The <xref href="System.Object"></xref> to add.
parentObject or childObj contains a null reference (`Nothing` in Visual Basic).
Returns a Boolean that indicates whether the specified object can be serialized to a string.
The <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Serialization.WorkflowMarkupSerializationManager"></xref> used to serialize this object.
The specified <xref href="System.Object"></xref>.
`true` if the specified object can be serialized to a string; otherwise, `false`.
value is a null reference (`Nothing`).
Removes all child objects from the specified object.
Other than exception behavior, <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Serialization.WorkflowMarkupSerializer.ClearChildren%2A> provides no default behavior.
You must override <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Serialization.WorkflowMarkupSerializer> to provide logic for this method in an inheriting serializer.
The <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Serialization.WorkflowMarkupSerializationManager"></xref> supporting this operation.
The <xref href="System.Object"></xref> from which to remove all child objects.
obj is a null reference (`Nothing`).
Represents an attached <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.DependencyProperty"></xref> that is used to define which assemblies to reference for custom activities.
For more information about this dependency property, see [Using Workflow Markup](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/e2693a12-640b-4ccb-8fb0-db3075e94aa4).
Creates an instance of the specified <xref href="System.Type"></xref> using the specified <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Serialization.WorkflowMarkupSerializationManager"></xref>.
<xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Serialization.WorkflowMarkupSerializer.CreateInstance%2A> uses the type constructor that best matches the specified parameter.
The <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Serialization.WorkflowMarkupSerializationManager"></xref> supporting this operation.
The specified <xref href="System.Type"></xref>
An instance of the specified <xref href="System.Type"></xref>.
type is a null reference (`Nothing`).
Deserializes workflow markup into an <xref href="System.Object"></xref>.
For more information about workflow markup, see [Using Workflow Markup](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/e2693a12-640b-4ccb-8fb0-db3075e94aa4).
An <xref href="System.Xml.XmlReader"></xref> that contains the workflow definition.
An <xref href="System.Object"></xref> that contains the definition of the workflow defined in the workflow markup file or stream.
Deserializes workflow markup into an <xref href="System.Object"></xref> using the specified serialization manager.
For more information on workflow markup, see [Using Workflow Markup](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/e2693a12-640b-4ccb-8fb0-db3075e94aa4).

An object that implements the <xref href="System.ComponentModel.Design.Serialization.IDesignerSerializationManager"></xref> interface, such as <xref href="System.ComponentModel.Design.Serialization.DesignerSerializationManager"></xref>.
An <xref href="System.Xml.XmlReader"></xref> that contains the workflow definition.
An <xref href="System.Object"></xref> that contains the definition of the workflow defined in the workflow markup file or stream.
reader is a null reference (`Nothing`).
Deserializes extensible Application Markup Language (XAML) content from the specified string according to the given type of the property to deserialize.
`value` must meet one of the following criteria:
it is a primitive type, a string, an enumeration, or a <xref:System.TimeSpan>.
it can be assigned from the <xref:System.IConvertible> interface or from the <xref:System.Delegate> or <xref:System.Type> classes.
The <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Serialization.WorkflowMarkupSerializationManager"></xref> that manages the deserialization process.
The <xref href="System.Type"></xref> associated with the property to deserialize.
A string that contains the XAML to deserialize.
The deserialized <xref href="System.Object"></xref>.
serializationManager, propertyType, or value, contains a null reference (`Nothing` in Visual Basic).
Represents an attached <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.DependencyProperty"></xref> that defines the names for event handler properties.
This property is used only at design time, while programmatically emitting a workflow instance using the object model.
It represents XAML that references the event handler, which has not been compiled yet.
This property contains a `Hashtable`, with event name and event handler name-value pairs.
After compilation, the event property is associated directly with the handler.
Retrieves a list of child objects for the specified object
Unless overridden in a class that inherits from <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Serialization.WorkflowMarkupSerializer.GetChildren%2A> always returns `null` (`Nothing`).
The <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Serialization.WorkflowMarkupSerializationManager"></xref> which supports this operation.
The <xref href="System.Object"></xref> from which to retrieve child objects.
An that contains the child objects of obj.
obj or serializationManager contains a null reference (`Nothing` in Visual Basic).
Retrieves information about all events associated with the specified <xref href="System.Object"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Serialization.WorkflowMarkupSerializationManager"></xref> that manages the deserialization process.
The <xref href="System.Object"></xref> to search for event objects.
An array that contains information about the events associated with obj.
serializationManager or obj contains a null reference (`Nothing` in Visual Basic).
Retrieves information about all properties associated with the specified object.
The <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Serialization.WorkflowMarkupSerializationManager"></xref> that manages the serialization process.
The <xref href="System.Object"></xref> to search for properties.
A array that contains information about the properties associated with obj.
serializationManager or obj contains a null reference (`Nothing` in Visual Basic).
Overridden.
Notifies the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Serialization.WorkflowMarkupSerializer"></xref> that an object has just been deserialized.

<xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Serialization.WorkflowMarkupSerializer.OnAfterDeserialize%2A> is called immediately after the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Serialization.WorkflowMarkupSerializer.Deserialize%2A> method runs.

You can override <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Serialization.WorkflowMarkupSerializer.OnAfterDeserialize%2A> in a class that inherits <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Serialization.WorkflowMarkupSerializer> to perform any required processing on `obj` after it has been serialized to extensible Application Markup Language (XAML).
<xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Serialization.WorkflowMarkupSerializer.OnAfterSerialize%2A> provides no default behavior.
You must override it in a derived class to add any processing logic.
The <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Serialization.WorkflowMarkupSerializationManager"></xref> that manages the serialization process.
The <xref href="System.Object"></xref> that was deserialized.
Notifies the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Serialization.WorkflowMarkupSerializer"></xref> that an object has just been serialized.

<xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Serialization.WorkflowMarkupSerializer.OnAfterSerialize%2A> is called immediately after the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Serialization.WorkflowMarkupSerializer.Serialize%2A> method runs.

You can override <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Serialization.WorkflowMarkupSerializer.OnAfterSerialize%2A> in a class that inherits <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Serialization.WorkflowMarkupSerializer> to perform any required processing on `obj` after it has been serialized to extensible Application Markup Language (XAML).
<xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Serialization.WorkflowMarkupSerializer.OnAfterSerialize%2A> provides no default behavior.
You must override it in a derived class to add any processing logic.
The <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Serialization.WorkflowMarkupSerializationManager"></xref> that manages the serialization process.
The <xref href="System.Object"></xref> that was serialized.
Overridden.
Notifies the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Serialization.WorkflowMarkupSerializer"></xref> that an object is about to be deserialized.

<xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Serialization.WorkflowMarkupSerializer.OnBeforeDeserialize%2A> is called immediately before the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Serialization.WorkflowMarkupSerializer.Deserialize%2A> method runs.

You can override <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Serialization.WorkflowMarkupSerializer.OnBeforeSerialize%2A> in a class that inherits <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Serialization.WorkflowMarkupSerializer> to perform required processing on `obj` before it is serialized to extensible Application Markup Language (XAML).
<xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Serialization.WorkflowMarkupSerializer.OnBeforeDeserialize%2A> provides no default behavior.
You must override it in a derived class to add any processing logic.
The <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Serialization.WorkflowMarkupSerializationManager"></xref> that managed the deserialization process.
The <xref href="System.Object"></xref> that was deserialized.

Notifies the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Serialization.WorkflowMarkupSerializer"></xref> that <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Serialization.WorkflowMarkupSerializer.Serialize(System.Xml.XmlWriter,System.Object)"></xref> is about to run.

<xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Serialization.WorkflowMarkupSerializer.OnBeforeSerialize%2A> is called immediately before the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Serialization.WorkflowMarkupSerializer.Serialize%2A> method runs.

You can override <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Serialization.WorkflowMarkupSerializer.OnBeforeSerialize%2A> in a class that inherits <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Serialization.WorkflowMarkupSerializer> to perform required processing on `obj` before it the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Serialization.WorkflowMarkupSerializer.Serialize%2A> step in the serialization process has begun.
<xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Serialization.WorkflowMarkupSerializer.OnBeforeSerialize%2A> provides no default behavior.
You must override it in a derived class to add any processing logic.
The <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Serialization.WorkflowMarkupSerializationManager"></xref> that manages the serialization process.
The <xref href="System.Object"></xref> to be serialized.
Serializes the specified <xref href="System.Object"></xref> into a workflow markup file or stream.

You must serialize either a new instance of a workflow type or the root activity in a programmatically-created workflow to create workflow markup that can be used in <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.WorkflowRuntime.CreateWorkflow%2A> to create a <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.WorkflowInstance>.
For more information about workflow markup, see [Using Workflow Markup](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/e2693a12-640b-4ccb-8fb0-db3075e94aa4).
An <xref href="System.Xml.XmlWriter"></xref> that contains the stream or file used in serializing.
The object to be serialized.
obj is a null reference (`Nothing`).
Serializes the specified <xref href="System.Object"></xref> into a workflow markup file or stream using the specified serialization manager.

You must serialize either a new instance of a workflow type or the root activity in a programmatically-created workflow to create workflow markup that can be used in <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.WorkflowRuntime.CreateWorkflow%2A> to create a <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.WorkflowInstance>.
For more information on workflow markup, see [Using Workflow Markup](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/e2693a12-640b-4ccb-8fb0-db3075e94aa4).

An object that implements the <xref href="System.ComponentModel.Design.Serialization.IDesignerSerializationManager"></xref> interface, such as <xref href="System.ComponentModel.Design.Serialization.DesignerSerializationManager"></xref>.
An <xref href="System.Xml.XmlWriter"></xref> that contains the stream or file used in serializing.
The object to be serialized.
obj is a null reference (`Nothing`).
Serializes the specified <xref href="System.Object"></xref> to a string.

If a <xref:System.Delegate> instance is assignable from `value`, <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Serialization.WorkflowMarkupSerializer.SerializeToString%2A> writes the method name associated with `value` to a string.

If a <xref:System.Type> instance is assignable from `value`, <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Serialization.WorkflowMarkupSerializer.SerializeToString%2A> writes the fully-qualified name of the type associated with `value` to a string.
If neither of these conditions exist, <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Serialization.WorkflowMarkupSerializer.SerializeToString%2A> converts `value` to a string and writes the result.
The <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Serialization.WorkflowMarkupSerializationManager"></xref> that manages the serialization process.
The <xref href="System.Object"></xref> to serialize to a string.
A string that contains the serialized <xref href="System.Object"></xref>.
serializationManager or value contains a null reference (`Nothing` in Visual Basic).

Returns a value that indicates whether the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Serialization.WorkflowMarkupSerializer"></xref> should serialize the specified <xref href="System.Object"></xref>.

<xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Serialization.WorkflowMarkupSerializer.ShouldSerializeValue%2A> is called by <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Serialization.WorkflowMarkupSerializer> before it serializes the specified object.
The method returns `false` if `value` contains a null reference (`Nothing`) or if `value` and the <xref:System.ComponentModel.DefaultValueAttribute> of the current serialization context are equal.

You can override <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Serialization.WorkflowMarkupSerializer.ShouldSerializeValue%2A> in a class that inherits from <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Serialization.WorkflowMarkupSerializer> to customize how to determine whether the specified object should be serialized.
The <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Serialization.WorkflowMarkupSerializationManager"></xref> that manages the serialization process.
The <xref href="System.Object"></xref> to check.
`true` to indicate value should be serialized; otherwise, `false`.
serializationManager contains a null reference (`Nothing` in Visual Basic).
Represents an attached <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.DependencyProperty"></xref> that defines the type name, which will be created during compilation.
This value corresponds to `x:Class` attribute in XAML.
For more information, see [Using Workflow Markup](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/e2693a12-640b-4ccb-8fb0-db3075e94aa4).
This property is used only at design time.
After compilation, it becomes the name of the compiled type.
Represents a code example, embedded into XAML `x:Code` element.
This property is used only at design time, while programmatically emitting a workflow using the object model.
The property contains a `CodeTypeMemberCollection` collection filled with `CodeSnippetTypeMember` elements.
After compilation, the code is compiled as a part of the generated type.
